channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Failed pedestrian crossing lights, 29th August
item.description:
A40 Lansdown Road - crossing close to (East side of) junction with Shelburne Road. Total failure of traffic lights at pedestrian crossing. Lights totally out, call buttons to activate crossing not working. Needs fixing ASAP as crossing is well-used - even more so once schools return at start of September.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of potholes and patches in the road on the turning, 29th August
item.description:
This road has been like this since I moved in over a year ago, there’s always patch works done but driving down this road everyday is a nightmare and the more that there are patches done the worse it gets

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Elmfield Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes and speeding buses, 29th August
item.description:
The whole of Prestbury Road needs to be resurfaced - the surface is so bad that the buses and lorries are causing our house to shake when they drive past at speed. The same must be happening to other houses on this stretch between the roundabout and the service station. There is also a problem with buses going far too fast - especially the Marchants buses leaving or returning to the depot. Please resurface this road - patching up the odd pothole is not working
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 69, Prestbury Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown vegetation, 28th August
item.description:
Brambles are sticking our over the pavement which forces pedestrians into the cycle lane. Not sure who is responsible for ensuring these are cut back sufficiently to avoid scratching pedestrians, especially children (in pushchairs) who are in danger of being scratched in the face.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains, 26th August
item.description:
Water covers footpath where drains are blocked from Newlands traffic lights to roundabout. This forces pedestrians to walk oin the road which is a very busy 40mph road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Door in brook, 26th August
item.description:
A wooden door frame is in the brook.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Denman Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.title: Fly posting, 25th August

item.title: Flood sign needs collecting, 25th August
item.description:
Flood sign left since last heavy rain. 2nd sign near garden centre. Both no longer needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Abandoned shopping trolley in Montpellier Villas Road, 24th August
item.description:
This shopping trolley has been dumped in Daniel Keenan’s forecourt in Montpellier Villas. There are no markings to indicate which supermarket/shop it has been taken from.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Montpellier Villas, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain clearance, 24th August
item.description:
A drain opposite the school was recently cleared but the debris was dumped on the grass verge that is now killing the grass and looking unsightly
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battledown Approach, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are five potholes at the junction of Montpellier Villas and Suffolk Road., 24th August
item.description:
These potholes have been here for over six months and have gradually deteriorated. These are dangerous because vehicles turning into Montpellier Villas cannot avoid them because cars are parked on both sides of the road which leaves hardly any room to manoeuvre especially if there is an oncoming car travelling along Montpellier Villas towards the Suffolk Road junction.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Montpellier Villas, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long white paint line on road, 24th August
item.description:
There is an approx. 40 meters long and 15 cm wide white paint line that must have been spilled from a burst can on a passing car. It runs from the corner of Wellington Road and Pitville Lawn towards Pitville Circus. It's not likely to fade out, unless someone removes it with the appropriate solvent and equipment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Utilities Trip hazard, 24th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Christchurch Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
